desc: The FLT4 (FMS-like tyrosine kinase 4) gene encodes vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 3 (VEGFR3), which plays a role in lymphangiogenesis and the maintenance the lymphatic endothelium (PMID: 10762646). Vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF)-C signaling through FLT4 (VEGFR3) has been shown to mediate cell proliferation, survival and resistance to chemotherapy in leukemia (PMID: 11877295), and to promote invasion and metastasis of human lung adenocarcinoma cells (PMID: 16530705). Mutations in FLT4 cause hereditary Nonne-Milroy disease, an autosomal dominant form of primary lymphedema type IA (PMID: 11292664). In addition to its expression on lymphatic endothelial cells, FLT4 expression has been observed in lung adenocarcinoma (PMID: 12875690), colorectal adenocarcinoma (PMID: 12168824), head and neck carcinomas (PMID: 12784238), prostate carcinoma (PMID: 15701844), leukemia (PMID: 11877295), and Kaposi's sarcoma (PMID: 10068212). FLT4 expression levels were also shown to correlate with different stages of cervical carcinogenesis (PMID: 14648657). Few cancer-associated mutations in FLT4 have been reported.

articles.title: Vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF)-C signaling through FLT-4 (VEGFR-3) mediates leukemic cell proliferation, survival, and resistance to chemotherapy.
articles.reference: Dias S et al. Blood. 2002 Mar 15;99(6)2179-84.

desc: FLT4 encodes a receptor tyrosine kinase involved in tumor angiogenesis. Point mutations, frameshift deletions or overexpression of FLT4 are found in colorectal, prostate and lung cancers, among others.
